page.title: 18Buxhall - The Playing Field
page.content: The playing field in Buxhall provides open space for children and village events although little used for formal sports. It is used by the{local foot- {ball club,}playing in the Bury Sunday League, once a fortnight Sept/April. The club has 18 playing members, of whom only 3 live in the village. The{provision of a pavillion}is being discussed. It could be a catalyst for other activities eg cricket, bowls. A local architect has prepared estimates ranging from Â£6000 for self-build changing rooms to Â£17000 for a larger professionally built construction. {Other events on the field in 1985: children's party, November fireworks and bonfire, and Buxhall Historic Fair. This was organised by an ad hoc village committee and included a steam engine/veteran vehicles rally, flower, produce and dog shows.
